review_title: Do not be deceived! What CITC is *really* like.
pros: Some amazing people work at CITC. Many who provide direct services are there for the right reasons. Too many success stories of clients in crisis getting jobs, housing, connected back with their families, recovery, and much more. If you want to make a difference and land yourself in a department with strong leadership, CITC CAN be a great place to work.
cons: Too many to mention. CITC wants to portray itself as a company that treats their employees with respect and that everyone, from the top down, stay true to CITC's values of respect, accountability, interdependence, and resiliency. If you're under a great manager and leadership, this will happen. But it ends up being the luck of the draw for you as an employee. I did not land in a department with leadership that, well, actually knew how to be good leaders. When I would talk with my co-workers and hear about all the wonderful things their leadership was doing to support their staff, I kept being surprised and disappointed by the stark difference in leadership quality between my department and my co-workers. My advice? Stay away unless you can be sure you will be part a good program. And sadly, I don't think the CEO has any idea of what's going on.

pros: Friendly people and fantastic benefits! CITC has many departments, which means there are many different careers that could be chosen from when applying for CITC. The company's main goal is to support Alaskan Native and American Indian lives as much as possible by providing jobs, sustenance, and services. This is incredible to me due to the fact that we live and strive on their land.
cons: Quite the hierarchy here so difficult to growth once you've reached a certain position. It may take years to get promoted or even a slight chance you never will.

pros: Everyone is driven in their support of the organization's goal and believes in the work. Leadership understands that to offer the best work and service, staff must have a healthy work/life balance. All coworkers I've had the opportunity to meet and collaborate with have been kind and helpful. This has been my favorite place to work and had my most favorite coworkers! There's is so much opportunity for everyone here and our participants, it's incredibly fulfilling work.
cons:
Remote work flexibility is severely lacking and will affect amount of incoming quality candidates unless improvements are made. 
As with any organization that has large growth in a short amount of time, communication and other growing pains are being worked out. It helps me to view as an opportunity to practice patience, grace and readiness. Pay is typically close to market standards, but market standards currently aren't great all around.

pros: Excellent communication, robust benefits, positive work culture, team work focused work.

pros: The execs are very kind, most staff are also very friendly. HR is good about reacting to reports and the benefits are great.
cons:
Toxic work place mentality; it felt like "us vs them". 

They don't prioritize mental health.

I wouldn't recommend front desk for females. Majority of male staff are contractors or are untouchable; so even if they harass you or make you feel uneasy there isn't much that can be done. 

You typically have to report to more than one supervisor.(which is confusing)

You get moved around departments a lot.

Most of the other admin assistants are under trained. 

It feels like if you're not going above and beyond, you're not an asset to the team.

review_title: CITC is moving in the right direction!
pros:
I'm not sure what was going on back when the 2015 Glassdoor comment was written by a former employee, but today CITC is an amazing company. Just a few highlights include:

Mission driven organization with major focus on people (participants and employees)

Visionary, transparent, truly caring C-suite leadership who walk the talk & are far from pretentious or ego-driven. Also amazing is that they're all women AND three are Alaska Native. Great example of women in leadership.

Amazing benefits and wellness activities for staff (incl. Body Renew memberships!)

Working toward creating more leadership development & promotional opps for staff at all levels of the company

Have a lot of fun staff events (for ex. holiday party @ Bear Tooth)

Offer flexible schedules (4-10's, telecommuting)
cons:
Communication can be silo'd or not shared as well throughout the entire company (as appropriate). Seems CITC needs to get more organized aground this. Middle managers can get overwhelmed with daily operations which may be part of this issue. 

The company is experiencing great growth due to acquisition of subsidiaries and major funding grants.  Because of this, some employees may feel that departments are understaffed or over-taxed. I think efforts to get re-organized around this growth issue are in the works.

pros: It's a very friendly place to work at.
cons: There's not enough time in the day

Has blinded the CEO. Will eventually get caught and run this place into the ground. Board is completely unaware of the shady business practices that occur on a regular basis. Video game they made is an embarrassment to the native people.

Avoid this place if you want to grow.
